paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Met13dup, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary Transthyretin Amyloidosis with cardiac and neurological symptoms

individual_records.phenotype_details: Recurrent syncope, acute heart failure, paresthesia, postural hypotension, gastrointestinal symptoms.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: TTR gene analysis showed Met13dup mutation.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Acute heart failure, progressive lower leg paresthesia, indigestion.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: TTR gene analysis showed Met13dup mutation.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Persistent AF, coronary artery disease, recurrent presyncope.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: TTR gene analysis revealed Met13dup mutation.
By family screening, the same Met13dup mutations were in all four of her daughters.

During family screening, his son in his early 50s had Met13dup mutation without symptoms.

functional_data.summary: The Met13dup mutation is associated with a mixed phenotype of peripheral and autonomic neuropathy.

variants.segregation_data: The Met13dup mutation segregates with disease in families, as seen in the offspring of affected individuals.
variants.additional_notes: The Met13dup mutation is noted for its late-onset presentation.
key_quotes: Patients with Met13dup mutation in our series experienced an earlier onset of peripheral and autonomic neuropathy and later cardiac manifestations.
It is noteworthy that this late-onset variant presented as a mixed phenotype with peripheral and autonomic neuropathy as the first manifestation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
